name: Sujoy Sinha Roy
content: Sujoy Sinha Roy – ISEC Sujoy Sinha Roy Assoc.Prof. PhD Secure Systems, Associate Professor Dr. Sujoy Sinha Roy is an Associate Professor at TU Graz, leading the CryptEng group which specializes in secure and efficient cryptographic algorithms on hardware and software platforms. Dr. Sinha Roy is known for his work in post-quantum cryptography (SABER KEM design, efficient software and hardware implementations, and side-channel security assessment) and Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE design, hardware acceleration, and application). Dr. Sinha Roy earned his PhD in 2017 from KU Leuven, receiving the IBM Innovation Award for his thesis. Before TU Graz, he was an assistant professor at the University of Birmingham. He obtained his habilitation in January 2024. Teaching Digital System Design Cryptography on Hardware Platforms Cryptography on Software Platforms Focus Area Post-quantum cryptography Privacy-preserving cryptographic techniques Cryptographic proofs Past PhD Students Andrea Basso (co-supervised, currently a postdoc at IBM Zurich) Past Postdocs Ahmet Can Mert (Founded company) Current PhD Researchers Aikata Anisha Mukherjee Maciej Czuprynko David Jacqemin Florian Hirner Florian Krieger Photo taken when we were trying to find a patent idea in Tesla's research lab. Florian Krieger received the Austrian "Würdigungspreis" (2024), a federal award recognizing top 55 graduates among 16,000+ across all Austrian universities. Aloha-HE named finalist in the Open Hardware Competition 2024. Florian Krieger received WKO Steiermark Research Grant for his master's thesis on client-side FHE.
